title: Ingenia acquires six new assets for $102 million
text:
Ingenia Communities Group is on the verge of acquiring six property assets worth $102.7 million, including three existing retirement villages in NSW and Queensland, after raising $131.1 million capital on Wednesday.

Ingenia, which operates both holiday and residential communities for downsizing baby boomers, is spending $102.7 million to buy new assets. Craig Sillitoe

The buying spree includes the purchase of an established mixed-used community in Brisbane for $17.5 million that will add 150 income-producing sites and a further 10 development sites to Ingenia's portfolio.

Ingenia is also buying a pure lifestyle community targeting retiring Baby Boomers on NSW's Central Coast.

The $25 million deal will add 190 permanent homes and 10 development sites to the group's assets when it is finalised in December 2019.

The company is also conducting final checks on a $28 million purchase of an existing large-scale community in Queensland that currently has 200 permanent homes and 40 development sites. The deal is set to be completed by early next year.
description: Ingenia will spend $102.7 million on new acquisitions after raising $131.1 million capital.
